title: Ryzen performance too low?
body:
So here are my specs:
Gigabyte x370 gaming k7
R7 1700 @ 3.8 GHz
corsair vengeance 3000MHz @ 3200 MHz
XFX RX 480 GTR black edition (clocked @ 1338 MHz)
Running league off of an Intel 600p NVME drive diskmark showed > 1500 MBps

Before I had a similar set up with lower clocked RAM and a stock clocked FX 8350 with around 150 fps minimum and max of 220 in league games very high settings. Right now my current setup gets around 130 to as low as 110 fps and it bugs me. Any tips on optimization? 

I've tried:
- Updating bios
- Using windows creator update
- Turning SMT off
- Downclocking RAM to 2933 MHz

With no luck - in benchmarks and in other games my performance seems decent... cinebench score of 1680~, don't remember CPU-z off the top of my head. I know it's not the biggest deal but it bugs me when I have a 144Hz monitor that should be easily maxxed out in this game and it's consistently NOT. I get similar league performance off my Lenovo Y510P latpop. Like what's going on here?

replies.body:
Oooooooo you are probably a step ahead of me on the tech side of things, but we should still be able to get this figured out. 

One thing that should be able to help pretty quickly with in-game performance, try turning on the "close client during game" option in the in game settings. That will completely turn off the client when you're actually playing a match, which will free up some resources so your pc can run more smoothly. We could also try doing a [**clean boot**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974#wq7) to see if that helps much.

Hit us back up and let me know if that helps much or not!

I tried the closing client during game thing, it didn't change fps any discernible amount... it's a 16 thread processor as well and considering League only uses 2 cores I would certainly hope background process weren't the issue XD.

Also, I had already tried a clean boot when checking to see if my drive speed was the issue(originally was on a SATA 3 SSD with slower read rates) - it slightly improved performance but it's still an issue. Any other suggestions?

Is there anyway to specify which processing cores League uses?

Whelp, I asked our tech guys which processing cores League uses and it turns out that it should only be running off 0 and 1. I'm hesitant to try troubleshooting anything with those processing cores on my own, so go ahead and hit up our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). They're muuuuuuuch more knowledgeable about those types of things XD!

Yeah the performance is kind of pitiful, I have a 1700x @3.9ghz, 16 gigs of 3000 mhz ram, an asus 1080 strix GPU, I have a 1440p 144hz panel and I get around 110 on medium settings. This wouldnt be a problem normally but I get better frames in BF1 on ultra settings. League is easy to run on lower spec computers but the performance on higher end ones is ehhh, I know it would run much faster on an 8700k or 7700k but come on now (I am running it off a 850 evo SSD btw)

its not thermal throttling everything stays a nice 60c underload so I have no idea why I do better in way more intensive games other then bad optimizing for high core count systems with slower clock speeds, tried 1080p and got similiar performance to 1440p which makes no sense
Could be a GPU driver issue. Have you tried reinstalling the AMD drivers?
Yeah, I've tried a few different AMD drivers, as well.
See if either the CPU or the GPU are thermal throttling.
Nah CPU is well under 60C and GPU only ever maxes out at around 70C when under heavy load for multiple hours

I'm reasonably sure it's your GPU that has the problem, not your CPU. What resolution do you play in, by the way? Because I have the R7 1700 and the RX 480 too, and my rig easily runs League at around 300-350 FPS on Ultra for 1080p, which is why I don't think it's the CPU at all that's the problem.

My best guess is that it's some sort of patch compatibility issue with your GPU.

Right? like especially having a hit in performance going from FX 8350 to R7 1700 is just bad... I'm @ 1440p(and was on the FX 8350 as well) - I doubted League would be GPU bound at all, so I didn't even bother but I'll try dropping to 1080p in this next game.
Good luck, tell me how it goes. EDIT: Just tested League with my rig in 1440p. I'm getting 190-230 constant FPS easily on Ultra. Quite sure it's your GPU now.

What AMD drivers are you specifically using? and what's your GPU clocked at?

I did some windows clean up and managed to get to around 160 average in 1440p(I had no clue Windows 10 was so bad.. lol) but I'd like to just optimize further since it seems I have some headroom.

I'm using 16.11.5, EDIT:  I have it clocked 1450 mhz at 1.3V. Don't know if you can get yours that high though, took me a while to get it stable.

I have similar problems as well seeing drops to 80 fps as well as constant stutters 

It seems like the game is only utilizing 2 core or 4 logical cores when SMT is enabled 

Its quite frustrating especially when i know I should be easily able to run this game 

this is applicable with the R7 1700 overclocked to 3.8ghz and ram to 2666mhz with 13-13-13-33 timings on 4x8gb 3200mhz corsair vengeance led as well as stock speeds
